article.headline: LSU 63, Georgia 59
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) -- Jaime Lloreda scored 12 of his 18 points in the second half as LSU defeated Georgia 63-59 Wednesday night. "I thought our team really deserved to win this game," LSU head coach John Brady said. "We defended very well and rebounded the ball well." The Tigers (13-4, 3-3 Southeastern Conference) held a 55-45 lead with 5:54 remaining before the Bulldogs (9-8, 1-5) began to chip into the lead. LSU led 60-54 with 3:35 left, but the Bulldogs scored the next five points to cut the lead to one with 25.5 seconds remaining. Lloreda fed Brandon Bass for a layup that gave the Tigers a three-point lead with 12.2 seconds to play. The Bulldogs had a chance to tie the game, but Damien Wilkins' 21-foot shot missed the mark and Regis Koundjia grabbed the rebound to secure the victory. "We didn't execute as well as we would have liked on that last crack, but we still had time to get a look," Georgia head coach Dennis Felton said. "Our worst nightmare was how to guard their two post players (Bass and Lloreda). We just couldn't get enough stops to win the game." Bass had 17 points, while Darrel Mitchell added 12. Rashad Wright and Jonas Hayes each scored 14 points to lead Georgia, while Wilkins added 11 and Buzz Wehunt 10.
